page.title: 02Dean Parish Council
page.content: The Parish Council of Dean and Shelton comprises 3 Wards. Shelton is represented by 1 councillor,Lower Dean by 2and Upper Dean by 4, the Chairman comes from Upper Dean. Elections are held every 4years and usually over 60% of the 271 electorate vote. The Parish Clerk is paid Â£40 per annum. The Council meet 6 times a year with about 6 members of the public present and a Parish Meeting is held 1 a year with about 30 people attending. The main duties are general care of the Parish, grass cutting is organised, trees planted, litter bins provided and pressure is put on the County and Borough Councils to repair roads, provide signs ans sewerage and exercise sensible p;anning control. The annual precept is Â£250 with a penny rate yielding Â£305.
